review: I really only bought the chromecast because I like my gadgets and it was crazy cheap; so I figured I would give it a go. I was really impressed with just how easy it is to set-up (particularly if you plug it directly into a power supply as opposed to a USB connection, as it recommends anyway).The user interface isn't as aesthetic as the apple TV system, that's for sure. But the playability is there. I've been able to connect all of my systems (laptop, tablet, phone, games system) easily and stream from varying sources (internet, hard drives, USBs...). It is also compatible with apple products although I  haven't fully tested to what extent yet.Overall: Not many gadgets this useful out there for $35. Why wouldn't you buy it?!
author: Alex

review: More apps are promised everyday, yet today you can enjoy YouTube, Netflix, Pandora, and stream local media from you phone with Plex.Super simple to connect.  Just follow the instructions and add the device to your wifi.Suddenly, a new icon appears on Chromecast compatible apps in your phone.  This allows you to simple connect and stream whatever content to your TV.  That's it,  other than adding an attachment to your Chrome browser so you can stream from the desktop.Though in beta, you can stream the entire desktop to your TV.  Nice for me as a photographer who likes to see how an edited image appears on a different monitor.
